amendment.description: An amendment to prohibit the use of funds for any activity that would grant de jure or de facto support of territorial, maritime, or airspace claims made by the People's Republic of China on the international waters or territories of other sovereign nations in the South China, East China, and Yellow Seas.

action.text: Mr. Frelinghuysen raised a point of order against the Stockman amendment (A075). Mr. Frelinghuysen stated that the provisions of the Stockman amendment sought to change existing law and constituted legislation in an appropriations bill. The Chair sustained the point of order.
